question.title: How to automate move-classes-refactor into new Maven/Gradle modules?
question.body:
Aside: Longest-winded question I've ever made ... appreciate your patience.

Background

An organization has built a few micro-services using Spring Boot. Each of these live in distinct Git repos but sharing common a build pipeline and artifact repository. Each of these implementations are presently construed as a single Maven or Gradle module. Each of these repos publishes an OpenAPI or Swagger interface document for consumption across the organization â€“ which is lovely because folks using different implementation languages can consume these services.

The Aim: Seeking Deeper Communion Among Consumers Employing Implementation Language of Providers

It turns out a fair number of consumers of these micro-services are using the same implementation language and dependency stacks as the micro-service implementations. As such, it would be swell if each of these micro-services could publish a collection of classes that bridge the gap between OpenApi data types and semantics not otherwise available from OpenApi code generation.

Finally, the Question

Is there anything in any IDE or GitLab plugin, etc., which can do this re-org refactor in Java code base (Maven example):

From

- pom.xml
- src

To

Wherein public and implementation are arbitrary parameters to the tool:

- pom.xml
- pubic/pom.xml
- public/src
- implementation/pom.xml
- implementation/src

The most important point of this question is:

The tool does the necessary "move-refactor" from:

- src/**.java

to new implementation module :

- implementation/src/**.java

. . . and leaves moving

- implementation/src

into

- public/src

the responsibility of the tool user.

I appreciate everyone reading this far.
